titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG8341

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteer Militia,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, 4 April 1862.

Hon: Nat Gaither Jr
Sec: of State.
Sir

The following returns have been made from Head Quarters, which please record viz:
Lieut: James Roddy has resigned (date of term: 11 Nov. 1861)
Lieut: Green B. Eads has resigned (date of Com: 11 Nov 1861)
Lieut: John J. Roberts has resigned (date of Com: 9 Jan 1862)
Lieut: J. H. Millens Com: dated 12 March 1862 & forwarded at the time: it was intended he should rank from 25th Novr: 1861. the date of his predecessors' resignations. & in care of R. A. Moffets' commission of same date, he is to rank from 6th Feb 1862. the date of his predecessors' resignation-

-- I send One Commission for record viz:
(over
1861 Apl 4- G. Clay Smith Colonel-

I am
Sir
Very Resply
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl
